#!/bin/bash
# This is free and unencumbered software released into the public domain.
# For more information, please refer to <http://unlicense.org>

tempdir=/tmp/.0isrsumsource

# printing usage info
if [[ $1 == "" || $1 == "-h" || $1 == "--help" ]]
then
    echo "Usage: 0isrsum.sh [URL]"
    exit
fi 

# creating the $tempdir if not exists 
if [[ ! -d $tempdir ]]
then    
    mkdir $tempdir
fi

# cleanind $temp dir if not empty
if [[ "$(ls -A $tempdir)" ]] 
then
    rm -rv $tempdir/*
fi

# downloading target file and generating the info for IRStalk
cd $tempdir
wget $1
ls -ltr
file=$(ls -tr $tempdir | tail -1)
echo ---------------------------------------------------
echo
echo "$file (Downloaded on $(date "+%b %d, %Y, %T %Z"))"
echo "Source: $1" 
echo "SHA256: $(sha256sum $file| cut -d" " -f1)"
echo "MD5: $(md5sum $file| cut -d" " -f1)"
echo

#!/bin/bash
# This is free and unencumbered software released into the public domain.
# For more information, please refer to <http://unlicense.org>

if [[ $1 == "" || $1 == "-h" || $1 == "--help" ]]
then
    echo "Usage: 0isrsum.sh [URL or file]"
    exit
fi 

# Function printtext prints the filename, timestamp, source, SHA256 and MD5 sums of file $1 from source $2.  
function printtext {
    echo ---------------------------------------------------
    echo
    echo "$1 (Downloaded on $(date "+%b %d, %Y, %T %Z"))"
    echo "Source: $2" 
    echo "SHA256: $(sha256sum $1| cut -d" " -f1)"
    echo "MD5: $(md5sum $1| cut -d" " -f1)"
    echo
    echo ---------------------------------------------------
}

if [[ -f $1 ]]
then 
    dir=$(dirname $1)
    file=$(basename $1)
    cd $dir
    printtext $file "Unknown" 
fi

urlregex='(https?|ftp|file)://[-A-Za-z0-9\+&@#/%?=~_|!:,.;]*[-A-Za-z0-9\+&@#/%=~_|]'

if [[ $1 =~ $urlregex ]]
then 
    tempdir=/tmp/.0isrsumtmpdir
    
    if [[ ! -d $tempdir ]]
    then    
    mkdir $tempdir
    fi

    if [[ "$(ls -A $tempdir)" ]] 
    then
	rm -rv $tempdir/*
    fi
    
    if [[ $1 =~ $urlregex ]]
    then 
	cd $tempdir
	wget -v $1
	ls -Atr 
	file=$(ls -tr $tempdir | tail -1)
	printtext $file $1
    fi
fi

#!/bin/bash
# This is free and unencumbered software released into the public domain.
# For more information, please refer to <http://unlicense.org>

# This simple bash script searches http://127.0.0.1:43110/tvepisodes.bit/ for new episodes of series listed in $DataFile and opens the magnet links by transmission-qt.  

folder=$HOME/ZeroNet-master/data/1MagneTSMMkNmJTMsTGJtfuNsqGjzzXgQv

DataDir=$HOME/.tvepisodes
DataFile="${DataDir}/tvepisodes.dat"

NC='\e[0m' # No Color
RED='\e[1;31m'
BLUE='\e[0;34m'
GREEN='\e[0;32m' 

# Testing if Zeronet is running
ZeroNetTest=$(curl -s http://127.0.0.1:43110| cut -d" " -f3)

if [ ! ${ZeroNetTest}="/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D" ];
then 
    printf "${RED}ZeroNet is not running!${NC}\n"
else
    printf "${GREEN}ZeroNet is running.${NC}\n"
fi

# Creating $DataDir if it does not exist.
if [[ ! -d $DataDir ]]
then    
    mkdir $DataDir
fi

# Creating a template $DataFile if it does not exist. 
if [[ ! -f $DataFile ]]
then    
    echo "doctor_who=S10E04" > $DataFile
fi

# Exporting variables from $DataFile
source $DataFile
export $(cut -d= -f1 $DataFile)

# Searching for new episodes, opening the corresponding magnet links, and updating $DataFile
for s in $(cut -d= -f1 $DataFile)
do 
    SeriesName=${s/_/.}
    oldepisode=${!s} 
    newepisode=$(cat ${folder}/index.html | grep -i $SeriesName | head -1 | sed -e 's/.*\(S[0-9][0-9]E[0-9][0-9]\).*/\1/')

    printf "The old episode of $SeriesName is ${BLUE}$oldepisode${NC}\n"
    if [[ $newepisode =~ S[0-9][0-9]E[0-9][0-9] && $oldepisode < $newepisode ]]
    then 
	transmission-qt $(cat ${folder}/index.html | grep -i $SeriesName | head -1| sed -e "s/.*\(magnet:.*\)' target.*/\1/") &
	printf "The new episode of $SereiesName is ${GREEN}$newepisode${NC}\n"
	cat $DataFile |  sed -e "s/${s}=${oldepisode}/${s}=${newepisode}/" >   ${DataFile}.tmp
	mv -v ${DataFile}.tmp $DataFile 
    else
	echo "There is no new episode of $s."
    fi
done
